summary: I bring a conscientious and professional approach to the workplace, possessing strong organizational skills, excellent communication, and emotional intelligence. My creative side drives innovation, allowing me to tackle complex problems and develop novel solutions. With a broad international background, I have a nuanced understanding of social, political, and cultural contexts. I prioritize effectively, meet deadlines, and maintain high-quality standards.

education.field_of_study: Master's Programme in Society and Change

education.degree_name: Vocational Qualification in Business and Administration

certifications.name: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) in the Workplace

profile_positions.description: During this temporary post, I managed the contract administration for WASH SDG Programmes in Nepal, Bangladesh, and Uganda.
profile_positions.title: Interim Programmes Assistant

profile_positions.description:
In my role as a Board Assistant, I provided comprehensive support to the President of MSF-NL, acting as the main point of contact for both internal and external stakeholders. Throughout my tenure, I meticulously managed the President's agenda, handling the scheduling of meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.
Moreover, I managed the Remuneration Committee, supported organising the Board meetings, took and distributed minutes, and coordinated the logistics for the MSF-NL General Assembly. Furthermore, I led the Board Election process, ensuring a smooth and transparent electoral procedure.
profile_positions.title: Interim Board Assistant

company.name: Helsingin kaupunki – Helsingfors stad – City of Helsinki

profile_positions.company: Helsingin kaupunki – Helsingfors stad – City of Helsinki
profile_positions.description: As an Election Officer at the Municipal Elections, my responsibilities included registering the votes, assisting voters with special needs, and monitoring that no electoral fraud took place. Additionally, I participated in the daily counting of the votes to ensure compliance with the voting register. The work required accountability, integrity, good organizational skills, and professionalism. Further, excellent social skills were needed when guiding the voters at the polling station.
profile_positions.title: Election Officer

profile_positions.description: As a global citizenship educator, I facilitated educational workshops for adolescents in the form of interactive games. The games guided students to understand the historical background of global inequality and to acknowledge the political, economic, and social structures that maintain inequality in the contemporary world. I engaged the youth and increased their interest and knowledge of global issues as well as empowered them to become active citizens. My responsibilities included preparing and instructing the educational games, facilitating group discussions, and ensuring everyone's meaningful participation. I answered the students' questions on topics such as gender inequality, climate change, and poverty in an informative yet encouraging manner.
profile_positions.title: Global Citizenship Educator

company.name: Dutch Coalition on Disability and Development (DCDD)

profile_positions.company: Dutch Coalition on Disability and Development (DCDD)
profile_positions.description:
Dutch Coalition on Disability and Development (DCDD) is an NGO advocating for the rights of persons with disabilities in the context of development cooperation and humanitarian efforts. I worked for both DCDD and their partner organization Light for the Word (LFTW). 

At DCDD, I had ownership of the planning and management of building a new DCDD website. I created a user-friendly and accessible website by using WordPress and following the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines. This required thorough collation, and the use of strategic information on accessibility. Further, I was responsible for co-facilitating the humanitarian aid working group and documenting the meeting minutes. I also supported with creation of communication materials and assisted with planning, marketing, and organizing events that advocated disability inclusion in the context of development cooperation and humanitarian work. 

At LFTW, I supported the documentation of lessons learned and best practices within the LFTW inclusive humanitarian aid programmes. The documentation was later utilized in an advocacy paper aimed at increasing inclusion of the furthest left behind populations during crises. Finally, I assisted in mainstreaming disability in the training materials and manuals for disability-inclusive humanitarian response.
profile_positions.title: Disability Inclusion and Communication Assistant

company.name: Plan International Finland - Plan International Suomi

profile_positions.company: Plan International Finland - Plan International Suomi
profile_positions.description: I assisted in the programming and implementation of a project that aims to empower immigrant women and adolescent girls. The project was done with four groups, each of them consisting of 3 to 8 mother-daughter duos. My responsibilities included preparing and planning group meetings and activities together with a team. In the group meetings, I worked as an instructor for the adolescent girls by guiding exercises by applying participatory methods. The meetings were a safe space for the girls to discuss topics that were important to them and ask questions about adolescents' issues. The group meetings and exercises expanded the women and girls' networks as well as increased their knowledge of their rights and possibilities in Finnish society. Along with the regular group meetings, I participated in coordinating day trips and events for the women and girls. Further, I collected academic research data to support the project's funding application process.
profile_positions.title: Immigration Team Intern

profile_positions.description: I worked as a freelancer promoter multiple years while studying. My main tasks were customer service, sales and brand promotions. As a freelancer promoter, I gained experience in working at hectic and constantly changing situations, public speaking as well as assessing the needs of customers. In this position, I also further developed my organizing- and time management skills.
profile_positions.title: Promoter

profile_positions.description: Management Events organizes networking events for decision-makers. Each event is targeted for a specific industry and the aim is to create space for participants to expand their networks, discuss common interests and build a ground for new contracts. As a Customer Experience Assistant, my main responsibility was to take care that the events were proceeding smoothly and stayed on schedule, for example by ensuring that the meetings were taking place as agreed. My tasks also included assisting in the seminar halls by introducing the speakers and ensuring they didn't go overtime as well as facilitating the discussion after keynotes. Further, I worked in the reception where I used my customer service skills to welcome the guests to the event and to inform them about the day's agenda.
profile_positions.title: Customer Experience Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
-Working as a group leader
-Product and brand promotions

profile_positions.title: Promoter

company.name: UN Youth of Helsinki - Helsingin YK-nuoret

volunteer_experiences.description: As a Vice-Chair for UN Youth of Helsinki, I coordinated board meetings and chaired them when necessary. In cooperation with other board members and volunteers, I developed, implemented, and managed various campaigns, events, and seminars that advocated Agenda 2030 and raised awareness of the UN. In collaboration with the Chair, I wrote the UN Youth of Helsinki's annual work plan as well as the annual report and contributed to resource mobilization. As a team, we successfully fundraised donations for a development cooperation programme in Zimbabwe. I participated in organizing two study trips: a UNSCR 2250-themed excursion to Copenhagen and Sustainable Food Production-themed excursion to Rome. In Copenhagen, we visited UN Women, IOM, and UNFPA and discussed the thematics on youth, peace, and security whereas in Rome we learned more about sustainable food production from FAO, WFP, and IFAD.

company.name: UN Youth of Helsinki - Helsingin YK-nuoret

volunteer_experiences.description: As a communications coordinator, I was responsible for the UN Youth of Helsinki's communications, which promoted and advocated the values of the United Nations. I facilitated advocacy messages and created visual and written content for social media channels (Facebook, Instagram & Twitter), maintained and updated the UN Youth of Helsinki's website as well as created newsletters. In addition to the awareness-raising through social media, I gained event management and organizational skills by planning and executing various campaigns and seminars. The events I was part of organizing included seminars on Climate Change and Resource Wisdom, Children's and Adolescents' Mental Health from Human Rights perspective, and, Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights, in which I also facilitated the expert panel discussion. I also designed and implemented a zero-waste advocacy campaign and handled various administrative tasks. Further, I represented the UN Youth of Helsinki in different events, such as UNDP's 'Journey to Extremism in Africa' report launch and 'Survivors' photo exhibition. In a meeting with the UN Under-Secretary-general and Executive Director of the UNFPA, Dr. Natalia Kanem I discussed SRHR and youth involvement in decision making. As a volunteer of UN Youth of Helsinki, I got valuable experience in programming, project implementation, and management as well as working with different partners and stakeholders.

company.name: Global Development Studies student organisation, Keho ry

volunteer_experiences.description: Keho ry is a student organisation for those studying Global Development Studies at the Faculty of Social Sciences of the University of Helsinki. I was in charge of organising cultural and recreational activities, including the organisation's 25th annual ball.
